item.description:
Hi Everyone.

If you havent paid up, well, ya might not get in..LOL

JULY 18 2009 EVENT



You may have to contact Barbara and bribe her with ..something good..LOL

Looks like a good weekend so far as of July 13..things change though..we will have a few pop up canopees there also..



Write up:

Friendship at the Lake with Food, Activities and Boating. See below.
Saturday, July 18, 2009: 10AM to whenever.
If you are planning to attend the daytime get to gether,
please send a check for

$10.00 made out to
Barbara Giamattei, 3 Stephanie Court, Madison CT 06443.

This will cover your entrance to the facility, papergoods and
charcoal and some beverages. Rowboats, canoes, and kayaks are
included in this price. Please send a check for $10.00 by July
10.

CAMPING AND ATTENDING THE PARTY
If you are planning on also attending the campout then the
price will be
$15.00 per person.



Please send to above address. If you are
camping you need to send me this money right away. There are
only 8 sites and if we want them we need to book them
immediately.

Right now two sites are booked. I would be happy to book more
sites, but need prepayment to ensure reimbursement.

Please feel free to phone me with questions, 203 314 9121 or
bg3step@comcast.net

Looking forward to seeing you all and having what promises to
be a great time!
The camping cost can be shared among those that attend.



Private pristine lake and picnic area, owned by Yale University in East Lyme CT.
Nestled on mile long Powers Lake, surrounded by 1500 wooded acres.

Picnic Pavillion, beach front with doc and raft.
Activities Available: Fishing Dock, Horseshoes, Basketball, Volleyball, Pingpong room, Hiking trails.
Also available included in the price are free use of canoes, rowboats, and kayaks, LIfe jackets are available and required.

Since we will be having a "pot luck" please bring either a desert or side dish to share (for approx 8 people); and please bring your own grilling item.

We will supply the charcoal and paper goods.

Hope to see you there! Oh, and please remember to RSVP. Thanks!!

Directions and brochure: http://www.yalebulldo...

Sponsored by a member who works at Yale

Questions: email bg3step@comcast.net


Weather:

Updated closer to the event day.


Driving Directions:



From I-95 North:
to Exit 71 (Four Mile River Rd -- East Lyme), turn right off exit ramp and continue 1-1/2 miles to end of the road. Turn right onto Route 1, continue another 1-1/2 miles, turn left onto Scott Road. Continue two miles to front entrance on right side of the road. Follow dirt road 3/4 mile to check-in station and lakeside parking lot.





Optional Camping Feature: Two overnight campsites have been reserved and will be available on a first come first serve response. We will chip in for the sites which will be a very nominal charge. Please note that there are very clean outhouses available/ a private bathhouse with hot/cold water. If you'd like to camp, then please RSVP in advance to secure your space. If we find that additional sites are needed we will try our best to book additional sites.


Ok this sounds like a good day to play in the water especially for those that dont have boats.
Im not sure i will bring all my boats, maybe..will have to see, but will bring all the other party stuff.
Gas grille, and fire pit if looks like no wood available..maybe some other interesting things..


Hope to see you all there..
al-r

item.name: .Powell Lake Event at Yale Nature Ctr
